Text: Jess is clearly struggling| what should I do?
Option1: She has said she can do it and I believe her.
Option3: It would be a more efficient use of her skills to assingn Olivia to this task.

Text: I'll let her figure it out on her own| but should I plan for if she can't manage?
Option1: I should pay closer attention to the project and look out for mistakes.
Option2: It's important to show that I respect her capabilities without planning for her failure.
Option3: I will get Olivia to finish off the project so that she can correct any mistakes.

Option1: I will learn the algorithms myself so that I can help explain them to her.
Option2: I will assign Olivia to work along side her for support and to improve understanding.
Option3: I will go with her to the client to negotiate an easier implementation.

Text: Jess will probably not like me reassigning her| how do I best tell her?
Option1: Explain that it is a more efficient use of her talents to reassign her.
Option2: Explain that Olivia is better suited to this task.
Option3: Explain that the project is too important to make mistakes and she can learn in her own time.
